title: Spooky Pixel Hero (by AppSir/Darius Immanuel Guerrero)
author: DariusGuerrero
excerpt: SPOOKY PIXEL HERO [IMG] DISCOVER THE ORIGINS OF EVIL [IMG] PRESS KIT | WEBSITE | DISCORD WATCH TRAILERS [MEDIA] [MEDIA] DESCRIPTION You play the...
siteName: TouchArcade - iPhone, iPad, Android Games Forum
text:
SPOOKY PIXEL HERO DISCOVER THE ORIGINS OF EVIL PRESS KIT | WEBSITE | DISCORD WATCH TRAILERS DESCRIPTION​You play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that seems way too advanced for its time. But is it really just a game? A chilling homage to retro gaming – Rediscover the magic of classic games and retro platformers with a terrifying twist. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR combines the beloved aesthetics of vintage 2D pixel games with a deeply immersive horror narrative that will keep you on edge. Intense gameplay – Navigate through 120 challenging levels filled with traps and mind-bending puzzles that will make some players rage. Every step brings you closer to uncovering the dark origins of the game, but beware – the deeper you go, the more dangerous this nightmare becomes. Atmospheric and nostalgic visuals – Experience a beautifully crafted mix of 1-bit and 8-bit pixel art that captures the eerie aesthetic of the vintage 70s and 80s gaming era. Uncover the hidden story – As you progress, piece together the sinister backstory of the game. Encounter pixelated spirits, ghostly glitches, and Lovecraftian horrors lurking within the code. Can you survive the nightmare and reveal the truth?Immerse yourself in nostalgic graphics and pixel art that blend nostalgia with spine-tingling nightmares, bringing an eerie world to life.Test your skills with platformer levels filled with rage-inducing traps and puzzles.Unravel a compelling story that blends retro charm with modern horror elements. Step into the shoes of a hero battling through a 2D nightmare, where every glitch and ghostly encounter brings you closer to the truth. SPOOKY PIXEL HERO is a journey into the heart of retro horror. Spooky Pixel Hero You play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that se… DetailsYou play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that seems way too advanced for its time. But is it really just a game? A chilling homage to retro gaming – Rediscover the magic of classic games and retro platformers with a terrifying twist. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR combines the beloved aesthetics of vintage 2D pixel games with a deeply immersive horror narrative that will keep you on edge. Intense gameplay – Navigate through 120 challenging levels filled with traps and mind-bending puzzles that will make some players rage. Every step brings you closer to uncovering the dark origins of the game, but beware – the deeper you go, the more dangerous this nightmare becomes. Atmospheric and nostalgic visuals – Experience a beautifully crafted mix of 1-bit and 8-bit pixel art that captures the eerie aesthetic of the vintage 70s and 80s gaming era. Uncover the hidden story – As you progress, piece together the sinister backstory of the game. Encounter pixelated spirits, ghostly glitches, and Lovecraftian horrors lurking within the code. Can you survive the nightmare and reveal the truth? Key Features: • Retro Pixel Art: Immerse yourself in nostalgic graphics and pixel art that blend nostalgia with spine-tingling nightmares, bringing an eerie world to life. • Challenging Platforming: Test your skills with platformer levels filled with rage-inducing traps and puzzles. • Haunting Narrative: Unravel a compelling story that blends retro charm with modern horror elements. Step into the shoes of a hero battling through a 2D nightmare, where every glitch and ghostly encounter brings you closer to the truth. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR is a journey into the heart of retro horror. Seller:Darius Immanuel Guerrero TouchArcade Rating:Unrated Compatibility:HD Universal It's available for me now. It's a 37 MB download, nice. ( °⌓°) I really tried to make the game lo-fi and feel like a simple game from decades past so in the end I accidentally made it optimized and have such a small file size too haha Enjoy Spooky Pixel Hero! No jumpscares in this one If including sound as a kind of jumps scares, there are many though There are people I 100% know will play this game and you're one of them! Thank you for always supporting my weird universe of games!you as well. thanks for being a fan of the games all these years! more games to comethat's true. thanks for playing Spooky Pixel Hero! Lull4by and ColeDaddy like this. ColeDaddy Silver Supporter
Moderator Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze DG, please consider a repository where we can reread the corrected documents. I wanted to revisit Walter’s docs but can’t. Edit: Also, level 62 is impossible Edit: Level 62 is possible Good call. I should have thought about it sooner. It might take a while for that though as I would have to redo the layout of some menus to fit it in the main menu or something and also design that menu to access unlocked notes, but definitely something I consider for a future update. Thanks! BENCOMO Well-Known Member Patreon Silver I never miss a release by the mighty Darius! getting this now! congrats on the release! Staff Member Patreon Bronze I’ve been screenshotting Walter’s messages. I love the game lore, story, and everything about Walter’s memories. I don’t know how far in I am (played the debugging game about 5 times so far Edit: on level 68) but it’s a rage fest in the best possible way. Easily your best game yet. Love that it‘s portrait. Controls are tight. And story so far is really intriguing. Super fun to play. TBH that is pretty good advice haha. Thank you for the recommendation! Please enjoy the game!No surprise you'd enjoy a good rage fest. Thank you so much AKD!You have no idea how much it means to me whenever people think my latest game (whichever it is at the time) is my best one. Thanks for that! Have fun! I'm really enjoying this game! I'm currently on level 36 and have a couple of suggestions. It would be great if I could continue playing without being redirected to the game over screen. Also, the controls are a bit too close together. Aside from that, this is one of the best portrait-mode games I've played in a long time . I'm glad you're enjoying! It says a lot about your enjoyment of the game that you want to head right back into action after a death. Noted on the feedback. Thank you so much for the kind words! ColeDaddy Silver Supporter
Moderator Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze One of the key aspects I really appreciate in DG's work is the thoughtfully expansive world-building birthed in his first games and continued into his latest and greatest. Each game presents a new chapter in the DERE.EXE mythos taking players on a darkly, fantastical journey at an accessible price point. The games themselves are fun, twisted, enchanting and, sometimes…quite spooky. Another banger from AppSir! That was a beautiful review of the AppSir Games Universe. Thank you, @ColeDaddy. I really appreciate it. I want to keep making more of these and I sure hope I can. But maybe I'll get to. Maybe... the games have just begun. I love it! Insane platforming and lots of mystery. A true indie experience. Thanks for that! The spirit of indie lives on! Staff Member Patreon Bronze Share This Page
html:
1. SPOOKY PIXEL HERO

    DISCOVER THE ORIGINS OF EVIL

    PRESS KIT | WEBSITE | DISCORD

    WATCH TRAILERS

    DESCRIPTION​

    You play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that seems way too advanced for its time. But is it really just a game?

    A chilling homage to retro gaming – Rediscover the magic of classic games and retro platformers with a terrifying twist. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR combines the beloved aesthetics of vintage 2D pixel games with a deeply immersive horror narrative that will keep you on edge.

    Intense gameplay – Navigate through 120 challenging levels filled with traps and mind-bending puzzles that will make some players rage. Every step brings you closer to uncovering the dark origins of the game, but beware – the deeper you go, the more dangerous this nightmare becomes.

    Atmospheric and nostalgic visuals – Experience a beautifully crafted mix of 1-bit and 8-bit pixel art that captures the eerie aesthetic of the vintage 70s and 80s gaming era.

    Uncover the hidden story – As you progress, piece together the sinister backstory of the game. Encounter pixelated spirits, ghostly glitches, and Lovecraftian horrors lurking within the code. Can you survive the nightmare and reveal the truth?

    Immerse yourself in nostalgic graphics and pixel art that blend nostalgia with spine-tingling nightmares, bringing an eerie world to life.Test your skills with platformer levels filled with rage-inducing traps and puzzles.Unravel a compelling story that blends retro charm with modern horror elements. Step into the shoes of a hero battling through a 2D nightmare, where every glitch and ghostly encounter brings you closer to the truth. SPOOKY PIXEL HERO is a journey into the heart of retro horror.

    Spooky Pixel Hero

    You play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that se…
    Details
    You play the role of a game developer tasked by a secret organization to repair a lost platformer game from 1976 that seems way too advanced for its time. But is it really just a game? A chilling homage to retro gaming – Rediscover the magic of classic games and retro platformers with a terrifying twist. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR combines the beloved aesthetics of vintage 2D pixel games with a deeply immersive horror narrative that will keep you on edge. Intense gameplay – Navigate through 120 challenging levels filled with traps and mind-bending puzzles that will make some players rage. Every step brings you closer to uncovering the dark origins of the game, but beware – the deeper you go, the more dangerous this nightmare becomes. Atmospheric and nostalgic visuals – Experience a beautifully crafted mix of 1-bit and 8-bit pixel art that captures the eerie aesthetic of the vintage 70s and 80s gaming era. Uncover the hidden story – As you progress, piece together the sinister backstory of the game. Encounter pixelated spirits, ghostly glitches, and Lovecraftian horrors lurking within the code. Can you survive the nightmare and reveal the truth? Key Features: • Retro Pixel Art: Immerse yourself in nostalgic graphics and pixel art that blend nostalgia with spine-tingling nightmares, bringing an eerie world to life. • Challenging Platforming: Test your skills with platformer levels filled with rage-inducing traps and puzzles. • Haunting Narrative: Unravel a compelling story that blends retro charm with modern horror elements. Step into the shoes of a hero battling through a 2D nightmare, where every glitch and ghostly encounter brings you closer to the truth. SPOOKY PIXEL HORROR is a journey into the heart of retro horror.
    Seller:Darius Immanuel Guerrero
    TouchArcade Rating:Unrated
    Compatibility:HD Universal

  2. It's available for me now.

    It's a 37 MB download, nice.
    ( °⌓°)

  3. I really tried to make the game lo-fi and feel like a simple game from decades past so in the end I accidentally made it optimized and have such a small file size too haha

    Enjoy Spooky Pixel Hero!

  5. No jumpscares in this one
  6. If including sound as a kind of jumps scares, there are many though
  7. There are people I 100% know will play this game and you're one of them! Thank you for always supporting my weird universe of games!you as well. thanks for being a fan of the games all these years! more games to comethat's true. thanks for playing Spooky Pixel Hero!
    Lull4by and ColeDaddy like this.

  8. ColeDaddy Silver Supporter<br>Moderator
    Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze

    DG, please consider a repository where we can reread the corrected documents. I wanted to revisit Walter’s docs but can’t.

    Edit: Also, level 62 is impossible
    Edit: Level 62 is possible

  9. Good call. I should have thought about it sooner.

    It might take a while for that though as I would have to redo the layout of some menus to fit it in the main menu or something and also design that menu to access unlocked notes, but definitely something I consider for a future update. Thanks!

  10. BENCOMO Well-Known Member
    Patreon Silver

    I never miss a release by the mighty Darius! getting this now! congrats on the release!

  11. Staff Member Patreon Bronze

    I’ve been screenshotting Walter’s messages. I love the game lore, story, and everything about Walter’s memories. I don’t know how far in I am (played the debugging game about 5 times so far Edit: on level 68) but it’s a rage fest in the best possible way.
  12. Easily your best game yet. Love that it‘s portrait. Controls are tight. And story so far is really intriguing. Super fun to play.
  13. TBH that is pretty good advice haha. Thank you for the recommendation! Please enjoy the game!No surprise you'd enjoy a good rage fest. Thank you so much AKD!You have no idea how much it means to me whenever people think my latest game (whichever it is at the time) is my best one. Thanks for that! Have fun!
  14. I'm really enjoying this game! I'm currently on level 36 and have a couple of suggestions. It would be great if I could continue playing without being redirected to the game over screen.

    Also, the controls are a bit too close together. Aside from that, this is one of the best portrait-mode games I've played in a long time .

  15. I'm glad you're enjoying! It says a lot about your enjoyment of the game that you want to head right back into action after a death. Noted on the feedback. Thank you so much for the kind words!

  16. ColeDaddy Silver Supporter<br>Moderator
    Staff Member Patreon Silver Patreon Gold Patreon Bronze

    One of the key aspects I really appreciate in DG's work is the thoughtfully expansive world-building birthed in his first games and continued into his latest and greatest. Each game presents a new chapter in the DERE.EXE mythos taking players on a darkly, fantastical journey at an accessible price point. The games themselves are fun, twisted, enchanting and, sometimes…quite spooky. Another banger from AppSir!
  17. That was a beautiful review of the AppSir Games Universe. Thank you, @ColeDaddy. I really appreciate it.

    I want to keep making more of these and I sure hope I can.

    But maybe I'll get to. Maybe... the games have just begun.

  18. I love it! Insane platforming and lots of mystery. A true indie experience.
  19. Thanks for that! The spirit of indie lives on!

  20. Staff Member Patreon Bronze
